text: one thing that leaders always have to do
is to realize that the world that
they're going to have to lead and is
changing for anybody to be able to be
ambitious and to be um successful and to
have a meaningful career built on their
ambition they need to be
supported how can the school both do
research but also create the conditions
within itself but in the business
Community more broadly to enable women
to be fully integrated into business
life in the same way that men are I
think the work of supporting women's
ambition really starts right here at the
school I think there are lots of things
that we can do that we're not doing as
much progress as we've made in the last
50 years there's so much more to do
while women represent 40% of our
entering class they certainly don't
represent that proportion of the CEOs of
the 14e 500 companies we're really
thinking about leadership in a broad
sense so not just corporate leadership
not just advancing women into of the
traditional domains that we think of
when we think of business but also some
of the places where we know that women
have been exercising leadership in ways
that have not really been sufficiently
acknowledged uh recognized celebrated by
the school and so that's something that
I think we have an opportunity to do um
with this celebration we are committed
to making the world a place in which men
and women both can Thrive so as we mark
this 50th year I hope that we will in a
very profound way continue to change the
role of women women in

business
